network.title: Network Connection Failed
network.message: Unable to connect to the server. Please check your network settings.
solutions: Try again in a few moments

connectionRefused.title: Backend Service Not Running
connectionRefused.message: The backend service is not started. Please click to start it.
causes: Port is occupied by another process

notFound.title: Server Not Found
notFound.message: The server address could not be resolved.

timeout.title: Request Timeout
timeout.message: The request took too long to complete.

unauthorized.title: Invalid or Expired API Key
unauthorized.message: Your API key is invalid or has expired.
solutions: Check your API key in settings

forbidden.title: Access Denied
forbidden.message: You do not have permission to perform this action.

resourceNotFound.title: Resource Not Found
resourceNotFound.message: The requested resource does not exist.
solutions: Navigate to the list and find the resource

serverError.title: Server Error
serverError.message: An internal server error occurred. Please try again later.
solutions: Wait a moment and try again
Contact support if the problem persists

serviceUnavailable.title: Service Unavailable
serviceUnavailable.message: The service is temporarily unavailable. Please try again later.

validation.title: Validation Error
validation.message: The submitted data is invalid. Please check your input.

unknown.title: Unexpected Error
unknown.message: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.

errorMessage.title: Error
errorMessage.defaultMessage: An error occurred, please try again.

confirmDialog.title: Confirm Action
confirmDialog.message: Are you sure you want to proceed?

alerts.networkError: Network error, please check your connection.
alerts.sessionExpired: Your session has expired, please log in again.
alerts.unauthorized: You do not have permission to perform this action.
alerts.notFound: The requested resource was not found.
alerts.serverError: Server error, please try again later.
alerts.validationError: Please check your input and try again.

validation.patternMismatch: Format does not match the required pattern

gettingStarted.title: Welcome to OpenClaw
gettingStarted.subtitle: Follow the steps below to complete the setup

install.title: Check CLI Installation
install.description: Verify that OpenClaw CLI is properly installed on your system.
install.installHint: Click the button below to automatically install OpenClaw CLI

model.title: Configure Model Provider
model.description: Select your AI model provider and enter your API key.

platform.title: Select Connection Platform
platform.description: Choose a messaging platform to connect with OpenClaw.
platform.tokenHint: You can configure this later in the Channels page.

test.title: Test Connection
test.description: Verify your configuration by testing the connection.
test.readyToGo: Your OpenClaw is ready to use.

complete.title: Setup Complete!
complete.description: Your OpenClaw is now configured and ready to use.

gettingStarted.cliInstalledDesc: OpenClaw CLI is correctly installed, you can proceed to the next step
gettingStarted.cliNotInstalledDesc: Click the button below to automatically install OpenClaw CLI
gettingStarted.testConnectionDesc: Click the button below to verify configuration
gettingStarted.testSuccessDesc: All configurations are correct, you can start using now
gettingStarted.testFailedDesc: Please check configuration and try again
gettingStarted.completeDesc: You have completed all configurations, you can now start using OpenClaw

dashboard.title: Dashboard Help
dashboard.description: Learn how to use the OpenClaw dashboard

overview.title: Overview
overview.content1: The dashboard provides a comprehensive view of your OpenClaw AI gateway status and performance metrics.
overview.content2: You can monitor gateway status, view real-time metrics, and control the gateway from this page.

metrics.title: Metrics
metrics.content1: Total Requests: The total number of API requests processed since the gateway started.
metrics.content2: Success Rate: The percentage of successful requests out of total requests.
metrics.content3: Avg Latency: The average response time for API requests.

control.title: Gateway Control
control.content1: Use the control buttons to start, stop, or restart the gateway.
control.content2: The refresh button updates the current status and metrics.

gateway.title: Gateway Help
gateway.description: Learn how to manage the OpenClaw gateway

status.title: Gateway Status
status.content1: Running: The gateway is operational and processing requests.
status.content2: Stopped: The gateway is not running. Start it to process requests.
status.content3: Error: There is an issue with the gateway. Check logs for details.

control.title: Control Actions
control.content2: Stop: Halt the gateway. This will interrupt all active connections.
control.content3: Restart: Stop and start the gateway. Useful for applying configuration changes.

modelProviders.title: Model Providers
modelProviders.content1: Configure API keys for different AI model providers.
modelProviders.content2: Click "Configure" to add or update your API key for each provider.
modelProviders.content3: You can test the connection before saving.

gatewayConfig.title: Gateway Configuration
gatewayConfig.content1: Port: The port number where the gateway will listen for requests.
gatewayConfig.content2: Token: Optional authentication token for securing the gateway.
gatewayConfig.content3: Enable "Restart after save" to apply changes immediately.

apiConfig.title: API Configuration
apiConfig.content1: Configure the backend API connection settings.
apiConfig.content2: API URL: The base URL for the backend API.
apiConfig.content3: WebSocket URL: The URL for real-time communication.

agents.title: Agents Help
agents.description: Learn how to manage AI agents

overview.title: Overview
overview.content1: Agents are AI assistants that can perform tasks and respond to messages.
overview.content2: Each agent has a unique configuration that determines its behavior and capabilities.

management.title: Agent Management
management.content1: Create: Click "Create Agent" to add a new AI agent.
management.content2: Edit: Click on an agent to modify its configuration.
management.content3: Delete: Remove an agent that is no longer needed.
management.content4: Toggle Status: Enable or disable an agent without deleting it.

filters.title: Filtering
filters.content1: Use the search box to find agents by name.
filters.content2: Filter by status (Active/Inactive) or type to narrow down the list.

providers.title: Model Providers Help
providers.description: Learn how to configure AI model providers

overview.title: Overview
overview.content1: Providers are connections to AI model providers (like OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.).
overview.content2: Configure providers to enable the gateway to route requests to different providers.

configuration.title: Provider Configuration
configuration.content1: Name: A descriptive name for the provider.
configuration.content2: Type: The provider type (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic).
configuration.content3: API Key: Your authentication key for the provider.
configuration.content4: Priority: Higher priority providers are used first.

testing.title: Testing
testing.content1: Use the "Test Connection" feature to verify your provider configuration.
testing.content2: A successful test confirms the API key is valid and the provider is accessible.

models.title: Models Help
models.description: Learn how to manage AI models

overview.title: Overview
overview.content1: Models are automatically discovered from configured providers.
overview.content2: You cannot add models manually; they appear when you configure providers.

configuration.title: Model Configuration
configuration.content1: Enable/Disable: Toggle model availability without removing it.
configuration.content2: Configure: Set custom pricing or context limits for a model.
configuration.content3: Test: Send a test request to verify the model is working.

pricing.title: Pricing
pricing.content1: Input Price: Cost per 1K tokens for input/prompt.
pricing.content2: Output Price: Cost per 1K tokens for output/completion.
pricing.content3: Pricing information helps track usage costs.

messaging.title: Messaging Help
messaging.description: Learn how to connect messaging platforms

overview.title: Overview
overview.content1: Connect messaging platforms to allow AI agents to communicate through them.
overview.content2: Supported platforms include Telegram, Discord, Slack, WhatsApp, and WeChat.

connection.title: Connection Process
connection.content1: Each platform requires different credentials (tokens, API keys).
connection.content2: Follow the tutorial steps provided for each platform.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.content1: If connection fails, verify your API credentials are correct.
troubleshooting.content2: Check that the bot has the necessary permissions.
troubleshooting.content3: Refer to the platform-specific tutorial for detailed setup instructions.

diagnostics.title: System Diagnostics
diagnostics.subtitle: Check system status and configuration
diagnostics.allGood: All checks passed, system is running normally
diagnostics.hasErrors: There are issues that need to be fixed
diagnostics.hasWarnings: There are some issues that need attention

cli.name: OpenClaw CLI
cli.description: Check if CLI is properly installed

gateway.name: Gateway Status
gateway.description: Check if gateway is running properly

error.title: Diagnostics Failed
error.message: Unable to run diagnostics. Please check if the backend server is running.

help.title: Need Help?
help.description: If you encounter issues, try the following steps:
help.step1: Ensure the backend service is running
help.step3: View logs for detailed error information

persona.title: Persona Management
persona.pageDescription: Manage AI personality settings and system prompts
persona.name: Name
persona.systemPromptPlaceholder: Enter the system prompt that defines this persona
persona.noPersonasDesc: Create a persona to get started

heartbeats.title: Heartbeats
heartbeats.pageDescription: Manage scheduled tasks and automated heartbeats
heartbeats.noTasksDesc: Create a task to get started
heartbeats.cronHelp: Format: minute hour day-of-month month day-of-week
